tit.e: Niizawa Senzuka-kofun Tumulus Cluster (a large tumulus cluster in Mt. Kaifuki in Kashihara City, Nara Prefecture)
Niizawa Senzuka-kofun Tumulus Cluster (a large tumulus cluster in Mt. Kaifuki in Kashihara City, Nara Prefecture)

sen.j: 新沢千塚古墳群（にいざわせんづかこふんぐん）は、奈良県橿原市南部の貝吹山に位置する総数600以上の墳墓からなる日本有数の大古墳群である。
sen.e: Niizawa Senzuka-kofun-gun Tumuli (新沢千塚古墳群) is a large group of tumuli which is the most prominent in Japan and which consists of over 600 burial mounds in total located around Mt. Kaifuki in the southern part of Kashihara City, Nara Prefecture.

Niizawa Senzuka-kofun Tumulus Cluster is one of the famous large tumulus clusters consisting of over 600 burial mounds in total located Mt. Kaifuki in the southern part of Kashihara City, Nara Prefecture.

Niizawa Senzuka-kofun Tumulus Cluster is one of the famous large tumulus clusters consisting of over 600 burial mounds in total located Mt. Kaifuki in the southern part of Kashihara City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 4世紀末から7世紀にかけて造営され、特に5世紀半ばから6世紀末まで盛んに墳墓が作られた。
sen.e: These burial mounds were constructed from the end of the fourth century through to the seventh century, and especially from the middle of the fifth century to the end of the sixth century a lot of burial mounds were constructed one after another.
The burial mounds were constructed from the end of the fourth century through the seventh century, and especially active from the middle of the fifth century to the end of the sixth century.
The burial mounds were constructed from the end of the fourth century through the seventh century, and especially active from the middle of the fifth century to the end of the sixth century.

sen.j: かつては川西（かわにし）千塚、または鳥屋（とりや）千塚と呼ばれていた。
sen.e: Niizawa Senzuka used to be called Kawanishi Senzuka (川西千塚) or Toriya Senzuka (鳥屋千塚).
Niizawa Senzuka-kofun Tumulus Cluster was used to be called Kawanishi Senzuka or Toriya Senzuka.
Niizawa Senzuka-kofun Tumulus Cluster was used to be called Kawanishi Senzuka or Toriya Senzuka.

sen.j: この古墳群の氏族ないし埋葬者は特定されておらず、大伴氏、漢氏（あやし）、蘇我氏など諸説ある。
sen.e: The clan which constructed these tumuli or the people who were buried there has not been specified, and there are many opinions mentioning the Otomo clan (大伴氏), the Aya clan (漢氏), the Soga clan (蘇我氏), and so on.
The clans or buried persons of these tumuli have not been specified; there are several opinions such as the Otomo clan, the Aya clan, the Soga clan, and so on.
The clans or buried persons of these tumuli have not been specified; there are several opinions such as the Otomo clan, the Aya clan, the Soga clan, and so on.

sen.j: 1960年代に同志社大学などにより調査が行われ、約130基が調査された。
sen.e: When the investigations by Doshisha University and others were carried out in 1960, about 130 tumuli were investigated.
When the investigations by Doshisha University and others were carried out in 1960s, about 130 tumuli were investigated.
When the investigations by Doshisha University and others were carried out in 1960s, about 130 tumuli were investigated.

sen.j: 武具、馬具をはじめとして副葬品は豊富に出土した。
sen.e: As a result, burial goods like arms and harnesses were excavated in abundance.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: As a result, burial goods like arms and harnesses were excavated in abundance.
As a result, burial goods like arms and harnesses were excavated in abundance.

sen.j: 特に、5世紀後半の126号墳からは、大量の装飾品とともに、日本史上初の火熨斗（ひのし、炭を入れてアイロンとして使用した金属器）の出土や、中国を経由せず西域から新羅経由でもたらされたと見られる希少なローマンガラス製品の出土があった。
sen.e: In particular, from No. 126 Tumulus built in the latter half of the fifth century, not only a large quantity of accessories, but also the first hinoshi (metal artifact which had been used as an iron with lighted charcoal in it) in Japanese history, and rare Roman grass products which had been brought to Japan not through China but through Silla from Central and Western Asia were excavated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: In particular, from No. 126 Tumulus built in the latter half of the fifth century, not only a large quantity of accessories, but also the first hinoshi (metal artifact which had been used as an iron with lighted charcoal in it) in Japanese history, and rare Roman grass products which had been brought to Japan not through China but through Silla from Central and Western Asia were excavated.

In particular, from No. 126 Tumulus built in the latter half of the fifth century, not only a large quantity of accessories, but also the first hinoshi (metal artifact which had been used as an iron with lighted charcoal in it) in Japanese history, and rare Roman grass products which had been brought to Japan not through China but through Silla from Central and Western Asia were excavated.

sen.j: そのために、古代日本の交易範囲の広さを立証する遺跡として報道され、当時全国的に大きな話題となった。
sen.e: For that reason, the tumulus was reported as the remains that proved how extremely wide ancient Japan had traded, and it became a great topic all over Japan those days.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: For that reason, the tumulus was reported as the remains that proved how extremely wide ancient Japan had traded, and it became a great topic all over Japan those days.
For that reason, the tumulus was reported as the remains that proved how extremely wide ancient Japan had traded, and it became a great topic all over Japan those days.

sen.j: これらの実物は現在東京国立博物館に所蔵されている。
sen.e: The genuine articles of these are now possessed by Tokyo National Museum.
The genuine articles of these are now possessed by Tokyo National Museum.
The genuine articles of these are now possessed by Tokyo National Museum.
